Then said they unto him, Who art thou? that we may give an answer to them that sent us. What sayest thou of thyself?
And he said, Lord, I believe. And he worshipped him.

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, Thou hast both seen him, and it is he that talketh with thee.

similars.text: Jesus saith unto him, Thomas, because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed: blessed are they that have not seen, and yet have believed.
Jesus saith unto him, Have I been so long time with you, and yet hast thou not known me, Philip? he that hath seen me hath seen the Father; and how sayest thou then, Shew us the Father?

And then shall ye know that I have seen Jesus, and that he hath talked with me face to face, and that he told me in plain humility, even as a man telleth another in mine own language, concerning these things;
To whom hast thou uttered words? and whose spirit came from thee?
Jesus saith unto him, Thou hast said: nevertheless I say unto you, Hereafter shall ye see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power, and coming in the clouds of heaven.
But I said unto you, That ye also have seen me, and believe not.

Jesus saith unto her, I that speak unto thee am he.

verses.text: And he said, Lord, I believe. And he worshipped him.

similars.text: Then came she and worshipped him, saying, Lord, help me.
And I said unto him: Believest thou the scriptures? And he said, Yea.
And he said: Yea, I believe according to thy words.
And when they saw him, they worshipped him: but some doubted.
He answered and said, Who is he, Lord, that I might believe on him?
Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.
And he believed in the Lord; and he counted it to him for righteousness.
And the man bowed down his head, and worshipped the Lord.

He answered and said, Who is he, Lord, that I might believe on him?
And the man bowed down his head, and worshipped the Lord.
And he believed in the Lord; and he counted it to him for righteousness.

verses.text: And Jesus said, For judgment I am come into this world, that they which see not might see; and that they which see might be made blind.

similars.text: And Jesus answered and said unto him, What wilt thou that I should do unto thee? The blind man said unto him, Lord, that I might receive my sight.

And now, my brethren, seeing that ye know the light by which ye may judge, which light is the light of Christ, see that ye do not judge wrongfully; for with that same judgment which ye judge ye shall also be judged.
Saying, Go unto this people, and say, Hearing ye shall hear, and shall not understand; and seeing ye shall see, and not perceive:
And dost thou open thine eyes upon such an one, and bringest me into judgment with thee?
Wo unto the blind that will not see; for they shall perish also.

verses.text: And some of the Pharisees which were with him heard these words, and said unto him, Are we blind also?

similars.text: They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind.
Therefore said they unto him, How were thine eyes opened?
Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. He said unto them, He put clay upon mine eyes, and I washed, and do see.
They say unto the blind man again, What sayest thou of him, that he hath opened thine eyes? He said, He is a prophet.
Then again called they the man that was blind, and said unto him, Give God the praise: we know that this man is a sinner.
And the Pharisees also, who were covetous, heard all these things: and they derided him.
Then answered them the Pharisees, Are ye also deceived?
Then came his disciples, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Pharisees were offended, after they heard this saying?

verses.text: Jesus said unto them, If ye were blind, ye should have no sin: but now ye say, We see; therefore your sin remaineth.

similars.text: And Jesus answered and said unto him, What wilt thou that I should do unto thee? The blind man said unto him, Lord, that I might receive my sight.
